noun.description: A group of words established by usage as having a meaning not deducible from those of the individual words (e.g., rain cats and dogs, see the light).
A characteristic mode of expression in music or art.
examples: they were both working in a neo-impressionist idiom

origin: Late 16th century: from French idiome, or via late Latin from Greek idiōma private property, peculiar phraseology, from idiousthai make one's own, from idios own, private.
